name: of
trans: indicating the relationship between a part and a whole.

sentences.english: the back of the house
sentences.chinese: 房子的后部

sentences.english: the last scene of the movie
sentences.chinese: 电影的最后一个场景

sentences.english: the end of the day
sentences.chinese: 一天的末了

sentences.english: to be proud of sth
sentences.chinese: 为某事自豪

detailed_translations.english: used to show what a part belongs to or comes from

name: with
trans: indicating the accompanying presence of someone or something.

sentences.english: I saw Bob in town with his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 我看到鲍勃与他的女朋友一起在镇上。

sentences.english: Put this bag with the others.
sentences.chinese: 把这个包和其他的包放在一起。

sentences.english: I always wear these shoes with this dress.
sentences.chinese: 这双鞋子我总是和这条裙子一起穿。

sentences.english: Mix the powder with boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 用开水把粉调和。

sentences.english: You’d better bring your passport with you.
sentences.chinese: 你最好把护照带着。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that two or more people or things are together in the same place

name: at
trans: indicating the location or time of an event.

sentences.english: They live at 18 Victoria Street.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在维多利亚街18 号。

sentences.english: Does this train stop at Preston?
sentences.chinese: 这列火车在普雷斯顿停吗？

sentences.english: I was waiting at the bus stop.
sentences.chinese: 我在公共汽车站等着。

sentences.english: Liz and her friend sat down at a corner table.
sentences.chinese: 莉兹和她的朋友在靠角落的一张桌子旁坐下。

sentences.english: Turn left at the church.
sentences.chinese: 在教堂那里朝左转。

sentences.english: We’ll meet at Harry’s (=  at Harry’s house  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们将在哈里家碰头。

sentences.english: I spent an unpleasant hour at the dentist’s.
sentences.chinese: 我在牙医诊所度过了难熬的一小时。

sentences.english: The film starts at 8 o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 电影8点钟开始。

detailed_translations.english: used to say exactly where something or someone is, or where something happens

name: from
trans: indicating the source or origin of something.

sentences.english: I'm from Italy.
sentences.chinese: 我是意大利人。

detailed_translations.english: used to show what the origin of sb/sth is

name: into
trans: indicating movement from the outside to the inside of something.

sentences.english: Come into the office.
sentences.chinese: 到办公室里来。

sentences.english: He thrust his hand into his coat pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他把手插进大衣口袋里。

sentences.english: There must be another way into the cave.
sentences.chinese: 一定有其他的路可以进入洞穴。

sentences.english: Sue got back into bed and pulled the quilt over her head.
sentences.chinese: 休回到床上，拉过被子蒙住头。

sentences.english: I’ve got to go into town this morning.
sentences.chinese: 我今天上午得进城去。

sentences.english: We dived into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 我们跳进海里。

detailed_translations.english: to the inside or inner part of a container, place, area etc

name: during
trans: indicating a period of time when an event is taking place.

sentences.english: During the summer she worked as a lifeguard.
sentences.chinese: 夏天她当过救生员。

sentences.english: He slept calmly during the early part of the night.
sentences.chinese: 他上半夜睡得很安稳。

sentences.english: Foxes remain hidden during the day.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸白天一直躲藏着。

detailed_translations.english: from the beginning to the end of a period of time

name: including
trans: indicating the presence of someone or something as part of a larger group.

sentences.english: The price is £25.50, including postage and packing.
sentences.chinese: 价钱是25.5英镑，含邮费和包装费。

sentences.english: You’ll need a variety of skills, including leadership and negotiating.
sentences.chinese: 你将需要各种技巧，包括领导能力和协商能力。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce something or someone that is part of a larger group or amount you have just mentioned

name: until
trans: indicating the end of a period of time.

sentences.english: The ticket is valid until March.
sentences.chinese: 这张票的有效期一直到 3 月份。

sentences.english: He waited until she had finished speaking.
sentences.chinese: 他一直等到她讲完。

sentences.english: Until recently, Anna worked as a teacher in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近，安娜一直在日本当老师。

sentences.english: Up until last year, they didn’t even own a car.
sentences.chinese: 一直到去年，他们连汽车也没有。

detailed_translations.english: if something happens until a particular time, it continues and then stops at that time
if something happens until a particular time, it continues and then stops at that time

name: against
trans: indicating physical contact with someone or something.

sentences.english: There was a ladder propped up against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 有一把梯子靠在墙边。

sentences.english: sailing against the wind
sentences.chinese: 逆风航行

detailed_translations.english: next to and touching an upright surface, especially for support

name: among
trans: indicating being a member of a group or in the midst of something.

sentences.english: The girl quickly disappeared among the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 女孩转眼消失在人群中。

sentences.english: I could hear voices coming from somewhere among the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 我能听到灌木丛中某个地方传来说话的声音。

sentences.english: We walked among the chestnut woods on the mountain slopes.
sentences.chinese: 我们走在山坡上的栗树林中。

sentences.english: She began rummaging among the books on her desk.
sentences.chinese: 她开始在桌子上的一堆书中乱翻起来。

detailed_translations.english: in or through the middle of a group of people or things

name: throughout
trans: indicating something that occurs or exists in every part of a place or thing.

sentences.english: a large organization with offices throughout the world
sentences.chinese: 在世界各地都设有办事处的一家大型机构

sentences.english: The disease spread rapidly throughout Europe.
sentences.chinese: 疾病迅速在整个欧洲蔓延开来。

sentences.english: The house is in excellent condition, with fitted carpets throughout.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子状况极好，全部铺着地毯。

sentences.english: We are open every weekend throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 我们全年每个周末都对外开放。

detailed_translations.english: in every part of a particular area, place etc
during all of a particular period, from the beginning to the end

name: despite
trans: indicating something happening despite a circumstance or obstacle.

sentences.english: Despite all our efforts to save the school, the authorities decided to close it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我们竭力想保住这所学校，当局还是决定把它关闭。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something happens or is true even though something else might have prevented it

name: towards
trans: indicating movement in the direction of something.

sentences.english: The money collected will be put towards repairing the church roof.
sentences.chinese: 募集到的钱款将用于修缮教堂屋顶。

detailed_translations.english: money put, saved, or given towards something is used to pay for it

name: upon
trans: indicating something happening immediately after something else.

sentences.english: an honour bestowed upon the association
sentences.chinese: 授予该协会的荣誉

sentences.english: We are completely dependent upon your help.
sentences.chinese: 我们完全依赖你的帮助。

sentences.english: Brandon threw him upon the ground.
sentences.chinese: 布兰登把他摔倒在地。

detailed_translations.english: used to mean ‘on’ or ‘onto’

name: concerning
trans: indicating something that relates to or is about something.

sentences.english: calls from young children concerning lost pets
sentences.chinese: 小孩子打来的有关宠物走失的电话

sentences.english: the facts concerning Marr’s car crash
sentences.chinese: 有关马尔撞车事故的事实

detailed_translations.english: about or relating to

name: to
trans: indicating the direction or movement towards a place or person.

sentences.english: The wind blew the door to.
sentences.chinese: 风把门吹上了。

detailed_translations.english: if a door is pushed to, it closes or almost closes

detailed_translations.chinese: 到；向；（表示时间、方向）朝…方向
detailed_translations.english: used to say where someone or something goes

detailed_translations.chinese: (To)人名；(柬)多；(中)脱(普通话·威妥玛)

name: in
trans: indicating being located inside an enclosed space.

sentences.english: There’s some sugar in the cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 碗橱里有一些糖。

sentences.english: My mother was in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲在厨房里。

sentences.english: He took us for a drive in his new car.
sentences.chinese: 他开着他的新车载我们去兜风。

sentences.english: I found her sitting up in bed.
sentences.chinese: 我发现她直直地坐在床上。

sentences.english: Manson spent fifteen years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 曼森在监狱里待了15年。

sentences.english: a hole in the ground
sentences.chinese: 地上的一个洞

sentences.english: Mr Fisher is in Boston this week.
sentences.chinese: 费希尔先生本周在波士顿。

sentences.english: My parents live in New Zealand now.
sentences.chinese: 我父母现住在新西兰。

sentences.english: I never went in pubs.
sentences.chinese: 我从不进酒吧。

detailed_translations.english: used with the name of a container, place, or area to say where someone or something is

name: for
trans: indicating the purpose or intended use of something.

sentences.english: I’ve got a present for you.
sentences.chinese: 我有件礼物送给你。

sentences.english: Someone left a message for Vicky.
sentences.chinese: 有人给维基留了言。

sentences.english: an English course for foreign students
sentences.chinese: 为外国学生开的一门英语课程

sentences.english: WWhat did you do that for?
sentences.chinese: 你那样做是为了什么？

sentences.english: We could hardly see for the mist.
sentences.chinese: 由于雾气，我们几乎什么也看不见。

detailed_translations.english: used to say who is intended to get or use something, or where something is intended to be used

name: on
trans: indicating physical contact with a surface or being positioned on top of something.

sentences.english: I wanted to punch him on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 我真想一拳打到他鼻子上。

sentences.english: Matt kissed her on the cheek.
sentences.chinese: 马特亲吻了她的脸颊。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what part of someone or something is hit or touched

name: by
trans: indicating the means or method of doing something.

sentences.english: She stood by the window.
sentences.chinese: 她站在窗边。

sentences.english: I was attacked by a dog.
sentences.chinese: 我被一条狗袭击。

sentences.english: a church designed by the famous architect, Sir Christopher Wren
sentences.chinese: 著名建筑师克里斯托弗·雷恩爵士设计的一座教堂

sentences.english: We are all alarmed by the rise in violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 我们都对暴力罪案的增加感到忧虑。

sentences.english: interference by the state in the affairs of the Church
sentences.chinese: 国家对教会事务的干预

sentences.english: his appointment by the BBC as a producer
sentences.chinese: 英国广播公司委任他为制片人

detailed_translations.english: beside or near something

name: about
trans: indicating the topic of something.

sentences.english: a book about politics
sentences.chinese: 一本有关政治的书

sentences.english: She said something about leaving town.
sentences.chinese: 她说了些要离开镇子的话。

sentences.english: He lied about his age.
sentences.chinese: 他谎报年龄。

sentences.english: About that car of yours. How much are you selling it for?
sentences.chinese: 说到你的那辆车，你打算卖什么价钱？

sentences.english: What’s he on about (=  talking about  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 他在说什么呀？

sentences.english: It’s about Tommy, doctor. He’s been sick again.
sentences.chinese: 医生，是汤米，他又病了。

sentences.english: Jo sensed fear and jealousy all about her.
sentences.chinese: 乔感觉她周围充满恐惧和嫉妒。

detailed_translations.english: concerning or relating to a particular subject

name: like
trans: indicating similarity or resemblance between two things.

sentences.english: I like your jacket.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢你这件上衣。

sentences.english: I don’t really like classical music.
sentences.chinese: 我不是很喜欢古典音乐。

sentences.english: Do you like this colour?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢这种颜色吗？

sentences.english: I like my coffee quite weak.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢喝很淡的咖啡。

sentences.english: I don’t like it when you get angry.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢你生气时的样子。

sentences.english: How do you like living in London (= how much do you like it )?
sentences.chinese: 住在伦敦你感觉怎样？

sentences.english: I quite like their new album.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢他们的新专辑。

sentences.english: We really liked the film.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常喜欢这部影片。

sentences.english: The time I like best (= like most of all ) is the evening when it’s cool.
sentences.chinese: 我最喜欢的时间是凉爽的傍晚。

sentences.english: I didn’t like the idea of being a single parent.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想当单亲家长。

sentences.english: Would you like a drink?
sentences.chinese: 你想喝一杯吗？

detailed_translations.english: to enjoy something or think that it is nice or good

name: through
trans: indicating movement from one side of something to the other side.

sentences.english: How many working days were lost through sickness last year?
sentences.chinese: 去年因为员工生病损失了多少个工作日？

detailed_translations.english: because of something

name: over
trans: indicating movement from one side to another side of something.

sentences.english: Will you be home over the summer vacation?
sentences.chinese: 暑假期间你在家吗？

sentences.english: Over a period of ten years he stole a million pounds from the company.
sentences.chinese: 他在10年间从公司偷走了100万英镑。

sentences.english: Can we talk about this over dinner?
sentences.chinese: 我们能否边吃饭边谈这个问题？

detailed_translations.english: during

name: before
trans: indicating the time or event occurring earlier than another time or event.

sentences.english: The new road should be completed before the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 这条新公路应该在年底前完工。

sentences.english: Let’s meet at our house before the show.
sentences.chinese: 看演出前在我们家碰头吧。

sentences.english: Larry arrived home before me.
sentences.chinese: 拉里在我之前到家。

sentences.english: We only got back from Scotland the day before yesterday (=  two days ago  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们前天才从苏格兰回来。

sentences.english: Other students joined in the protest, and before long (=  soon  ) there was a crowd of 200 or so.
sentences.chinese: 其他学生也加入了抗议队伍，不久就有200人左右了。

detailed_translations.english: earlier than something or someone

name: between
trans: indicating the relationship of two things or people when they are separated by something else.

sentences.english: He supplements his regular meals by eating between meals.
sentences.chinese: 他在两餐之间吃点东西来补充正餐。

sentences.english: The object of these experiments was to find the connection, if any, between the two phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 这些实验的目的就是探索这两种现象之间的联系，如果存在着任何联系的话。

name: after
trans: indicating the time or event occurring later than another time or event.

sentences.english: After the war many soldiers stayed in France.
sentences.chinese: 战后，许多士兵留在法国。

sentences.english: I go swimming every day after work.
sentences.chinese: 我每天下班后都去游泳。

sentences.english: Do you believe in life after death?
sentences.chinese: 你相信人死后还有来生吗？

sentences.english: The first attack started just after midnight.
sentences.chinese: 刚过午夜，第一波进攻开始了。

sentences.english: David went to bed straight after (=  immediately after  ) supper.
sentences.chinese: 戴维一吃完晚饭就去睡觉了。

sentences.english: After you’d called the police, what did you do?
sentences.chinese: 报警之后，你做了些什么？

sentences.english: Zimmerman changed his name after he left Germany.
sentences.chinese: 齐默尔曼离开德国后改了名字。

sentences.english: People still remember the 1958 revolution and what came after (=  happened after it  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们依然记得1958年的那场革命和之后发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular event or time has happened, or when someone has done something

name: since
trans: indicating the time period from a past event until now.

sentences.english: We’ve been waiting here since two o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 我们从两点钟开始就在这里等了。

sentences.english: I haven’t played rugby since I left university.
sentences.chinese: 我大学毕业后就没打过橄榄球。

sentences.english: She left London ten years ago, and I haven’t seen her since.
sentences.chinese: 她十年前离开伦敦，此后我再没有见过她。

sentences.english: The factory has been here since the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂从 20 世纪 70 年代起就在这里了。

sentences.english: It was exactly five years since her father had died.
sentences.chinese: 从她父亲去世到现在正好满五年。

sentences.english: Since the end of the war, over five thousand prisoners have been released.
sentences.chinese: 自从战争结束以后，已有五千多名战俘获释。

sentences.english: He lost his job five years ago, but has since found other work.
sentences.chinese: 他五年前失去工作，但此后找到了其他工作。

sentences.english: I left school in 1995, and since then I’ve lived in London.
sentences.chinese: 我 1995 年离开学校，此后就在伦敦生活。

sentences.english: About six thousand people were arrested, several hundred of whom have since been released.
sentences.chinese: 约六千人被逮捕，不过他们中有几百人后来被释放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因为；由于；既然；自…以来；自…以后

detailed_translations.english: from a particular time or event in the past until the present, or in that period of time
When you are talking about an event or situation in the past, you use since to indicate that another event happened at some point later in time

name: without
trans: indicating the absence or lack of something.

sentences.english: After the storm we were without electricity for five days.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨之后我们断电了五天。

sentences.english: a house without a garden
sentences.chinese: 不带花园的房子

sentences.english: We passed two ruined abbeys, one with a tower and one without.
sentences.chinese: 我们路过两座破落的寺院，一座有塔楼，另一座没有。

sentences.english: I’m getting used to managing without a car.
sentences.chinese: 我已经习惯没有汽车了。

detailed_translations.english: not having something, especially something that is basic or necessary

detailed_translations.chinese: 户外；在外面；没有或不显示某事物

name: under
trans: indicating physical contact with the lower surface of something.

sentences.english: These toys are not suitable for children under five.
sentences.chinese: 这些玩具不适合五岁以下的儿童玩。

sentences.english: Most of the events listed cost under £60.
sentences.chinese: 所列活动项目的花费大多低于 60 英镑。

sentences.english: I spend just under four hours a day seeing customers.
sentences.chinese: 我一天接待客户所花的时间将近四小时。

sentences.english: He took a deep breath before he went under.
sentences.chinese: 他在钻下水前深深地吸了口气。

detailed_translations.english: less than a particular number, amount, age, or price
Under is also an adverb

name: within
trans: indicating being inside or contained within something.

sentences.english: We should have the test results back within 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们24小时之内应该可以拿到化验结果。

sentences.english: He fell sick and died within a matter of weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他病倒了，不出几星期就死了。

sentences.english: Within an hour of our arrival Caroline was starting to complain.
sentences.chinese: 我们到达还没有一小时，卡罗琳就开始抱怨了。

sentences.english: The real dangers to these rebels came from within.
sentences.chinese: 对于这些叛乱分子真正的危险来自内部。

detailed_translations.english: before a certain period of time has passed
Within is also an adverb

name: along
trans: indicating movement in the same direction as something else.

sentences.english: We were driving along Follyfoot Road.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着福莱福特路行驶。

sentences.english: She glanced anxiously along the line of faces.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地扫视着这一排面孔。

sentences.english: He slid his hand along her arm.
sentences.chinese: 他的手顺着她的臂膀滑下。

sentences.english: I was driving along, thinking about Chris.
sentences.chinese: 我一边开车，一边想着克里斯。

detailed_translations.english: from one place on something such as a line, road, or edge towards the other end of it
going forward

name: following
trans: indicating occurring after something else.

sentences.english: He was sick in the evening, but the following day he was better.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上他生病了，但第二天就好一些了。

sentences.english: Write down the following information: name of product, type, date purchased and price.
sentences.chinese: 写下以下信息：产品名称、型号、购买日期和价格。

detailed_translations.english: the next afternoon, month etc

name: across
trans: indicating movement from one side to the opposite side of something.

sentences.english: He walked across the field.
sentences.chinese: 他走过田地。

sentences.english: There's a bank right across the street.
sentences.chinese: 街对面就有一家银行。

detailed_translations.english: from one side to the other side of sth

name: behind
trans: indicating being at the back of something or someone.

sentences.english: I turned to speak to the person standing behind me.
sentences.chinese: 我转身和站在我后面的那人说话。

sentences.english: Someone could easily creep up behind us.
sentences.chinese: 很可能有人跟在我们后面。

sentences.english: The car behind was hooting impatiently.
sentences.chinese: 后面那辆车不耐烦地按着喇叭。

sentences.english: Jane shut the door behind her.
sentences.chinese: 简随手关上身后的门。

sentences.english: The manager was sitting behind a large desk.
sentences.chinese: 经理坐在一张大办公桌的后面。

detailed_translations.english: at or towards the back of a thing or person

name: beyond
trans: indicating something being at or to the further side of something else.

sentences.english: They crossed the mountains and headed for the valleys beyond.
sentences.chinese: 他们翻过山，向更远处的山谷进发。

sentences.english: Beyond the river, cattle were grazing.
sentences.chinese: 河的那边，牛在吃草。

sentences.english: She drove through Westport, and stopped a few miles beyond at a wayside inn.
sentences.chinese: 她驱车穿过西港，在几英里外的一个路边旅馆停了下来。

detailed_translations.english: on or to the further side of something

name: plus
trans: indicating addition or inclusion.

sentences.english: Three plus six equals nine (3+6=9).
sentences.chinese: 3 加6等于9。

sentences.english: The total cost was $10,000, plus 14% interest.
sentences.chinese: 全部费用是1万美元，外加14%的利息。

sentences.english: Daytime temperatures barely reached plus 5˚.
sentences.chinese: 白天的气温仅零上5度。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or amount is added to another
more than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures

name: except
trans: indicating exclusion or something that is not included.

sentences.english: They were all there except me.
sentences.chinese: 除了我以外他们都在那里。

sentences.english: We all went except him.
sentences.chinese: 除他以外， 我们都去了。

sentences.english: They all howled with laughter except me.
sentences.chinese: 除了我以外，他们全都哈哈大笑起来。

name: but
trans: indicating a contrast or something that is not part of something else.

sentences.english: It’s an old car, but it’s very reliable.
sentences.chinese: 这是一辆旧车，但是性能非常可靠。

sentences.english: They rushed to the hospital, but they were too late.
sentences.chinese: 他们急忙赶到医院，但是已经太迟了。

sentences.english: We’ve invited the boss, but she may decide not to come.
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请过老板，但她有可能决定不来。

sentences.english: an expensive but extremely useful book
sentences.chinese: 价钱很贵却是非常有用的一本书

sentences.english: ‘Has he got any experience?’ ‘No, but he’s keen to learn.’
sentences.chinese: “他有经验吗？”“没有，但他非常好学。”

detailed_translations.english: used to connect two statements or phrases when the second one adds something different or seems surprising after the first one

name: up
trans: indicating movement in a higher direction.

sentences.english: We walked slowly up the hill.
sentences.chinese: 我们慢慢地爬上山。

sentences.english: She picked her jacket up off the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她从地板上捡起外套。

sentences.english: paths leading up into the mountains
sentences.chinese: 通往山里的小径

sentences.english: Tim had climbed up a tree to get a better view.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆爬到了树上，以便看得更清楚。

sentences.english: Put up your hand if you know the answer.
sentences.chinese: 如果知道答案就举手。

sentences.english: The water was getting up my nose.
sentences.chinese: 水已经没到了我的鼻子。

sentences.english: Karen lay on her back, staring up at the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 卡伦仰卧着，盯着天花板。

sentences.english: Are you sure you should be up?
sentences.chinese: 你肯定你该起床了吗?

sentences.english: These days they were up at the crack of dawn.
sentences.chinese: 这些天他们在破晓时就起床。

detailed_translations.english: towards a higher place or position
If you are up, you are not in bed

name: out
trans: indicating movement away from the inside of something.

sentences.english: She opened her suitcase and took out a pair of shoes.
sentences.chinese: 她打开手提箱，拿出一双鞋。

sentences.english: Lock the door on your way out.
sentences.chinese: 你出去时把门锁上。

sentences.english: Charlotte went to the window and looked out.
sentences.chinese: 夏洛特走到窗前往外看。

sentences.english: Out you go (= used to order someone to leave a room )!
sentences.chinese: 你给我出去！

sentences.english: When the sun came out, a rainbow formed in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 太阳出来时，天空中出现了一道彩虹。

detailed_translations.english: from inside an object, container, building, or place

name: around
trans: indicating movement in a circular direction or surrounding something.

sentences.english: What an inspiration she was to all around her!
sentences.chinese: 她对于她周围所有的人是一种多么大的鼓舞!

sentences.english: All those around him looked at him with amazement.
sentences.chinese: 周围的人都对他投射出惊异的眼光。

name: down
trans: indicating movement in a lower direction.

sentences.english: David bent down to tie his shoelace.
sentences.chinese: 戴维弯腰系鞋带。

sentences.english: Get down off the table.
sentences.chinese: 从桌子上下来。

sentences.english: Tears were streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 我泪流满面。

sentences.english: The sun was going down and it would soon be dark.
sentences.chinese: 夕阳西下，天很快就要黑了。

sentences.english: They came running down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们跑下楼来。

sentences.english: She stood on a balcony looking down into the courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 她站在阳台上朝下面的院子望去。

sentences.english: Glancing down the list of runners, I noticed a familiar name.
sentences.chinese: 我往下扫了一眼赛跑选手的名单，注意到了一个熟悉的名字。

sentences.english: Her hair came down to her waist.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发一直垂到腰际。

sentences.english: Ken fell asleep face down (= with his face towards the ground ) on the couch.
sentences.chinese: 肯趴在长沙发上睡着了。

sentences.english: We heard the sound of laughter down below.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到下面有笑声。

sentences.english: The bathroom is down those stairs.
sentences.chinese: 浴室在那段楼梯下面。

detailed_translations.english: to or towards a lower place or position

name: off
trans: indicating separation or disconnection.

sentences.english: He got into his car and drove off.
sentences.chinese: 他上了车，随即开车走了。

sentences.english: Will someone switch the radio off?
sentences.chinese: 谁把收音机关掉好吗？

detailed_translations.english: away from a place

name: above
trans: indicating something being at a higher level or position than something else.

sentences.english: He lived in a flat above the shop.
sentences.chinese: 他住在那商店上面的一套房间里。

sentences.english: The airliner flew above the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 大型客机在云层上面飞行。

sentences.english: The salaries we offer are well above (= much higher than ) average.
sentences.chinese: 我们提供的薪资远高于平均水平。

detailed_translations.english: in a higher position than something else

name: near
trans: indicating being close or in proximity to something or someone.

sentences.english: They live near London.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在伦敦附近。

sentences.english: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他们就住在这附近。

sentences.english: They moved house to be nearer the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家搬到离学校近一些。

sentences.english: She told the children not to go near the canal.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉孩子们不要走近运河。

sentences.english: I’m warning you - don’t come any nearer!
sentences.chinese: 我警告你别再靠近！

sentences.english: We heard voices as we drew near the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们走近村子时听见了说话声。

detailed_translations.english: only a short distance from a person or thing
only a short distance away from someone or something
